title: Is Python 3 documentation the best way to learn Python? - Quora

response.answer_text: Though, documentations are very focussed & organized, they might not be of great help for the beginners. I would rather suggest you to grasp the basics from some online resource/book and then head on to some task or project which would enable you to learn meaninfully. You could also opt for training from high-end training providers who go for a more hands-on approach.

Indeed they are but for beginners they can be very confusing. It depends upon your programming experience and how well you can read the documentation. I would never suggest a beginner to start with the documentation.
